Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

17.parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
17.str2: (a) To have mercy on, show favor to, (b) trans. with object of sins: To forgive, pardon.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From hamartano; a sin.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; a people.

18.str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

18.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
18.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

18.parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
18.str2: I am acted upon in a certain way, either good or bad; I experience ill treatment, suffer.

18.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
18.str2: To try, tempt, test. From peira; to test, i.e. Endeavor, scrutinize, entice, discipline.

18.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
18.str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
To come to the rescue of, come to help, help. From boethos; to aid or relieve.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

18.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Masculine Plural
18.str2: To try, tempt, test. From peira; to test, i.e. Endeavor, scrutinize, entice, discipline.
